amerimnon: <entryFree id="n2215" type="greek" key="a^me^rimno^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĕrimnŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)me/rimnos</foreign>, caredispeller</etym>, <sense id="n2215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> aïzoon majus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ames: <entryFree id="n2216" type="main" key="a^me^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, prob. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. amentum</etym>, <sense id="n2216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fork</hi>, esp. for holding and spreading bird-nets: amites: perticae aucupales, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 12</bibl> Müll.: aut amite levi rara tendit retia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 12</bibl>. —Also for bearing a litter or sedan: <cit><quote lang="la">amites basternarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amestratus: <entryFree id="n2217" type="main" key="A^mestra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămestrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the north coast of Sicily</hi>, mentioned only by Cic. and Steph. B., now <hi rend="ital">Mistretta</hi>, is prob. the same place as the Amastra of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 39, 43</bibl>; Steph. B. s. v.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămestrătīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Amestratus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 39, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amothystinatus: <entryFree id="n2218" type="main" key="a^mo^thysti^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămŏthystĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>qs. from amethystino</etym>, <sense id="n2218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wears a dress of the color of amethyst</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">violet-blue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amethystinus: <entryFree id="n2219" type="main" key="a^me^thysti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĕthystĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amethystus</etym>. <sense id="n2219.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of the color of amethyst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 7</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: amethystina (sc. vestimenta), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2219.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned with amethyst</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amethystizon: <entryFree id="n2220" type="greek" key="a^me^thysti_zo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĕthystīzōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mequsti/zwn</foreign>, <sense id="n2220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resembling the amethyst in color</hi>: carbunculi, prob. our <hi rend="ital">violet ruby</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amethystus: <entryFree id="n2221" type="greek" key="a^me^thystus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĕthystus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)me/qustos</foreign>. <sense id="n2221.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The amethyst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone of violet-blue color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 121</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 21, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2221.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ametor: <entryFree id="n2222" type="greek" key="a^me_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămētor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mh/twr</foreign>, <sense id="n2222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">motherless</hi>, Tert. Praescr. cap. 53.</sense></entryFree>
amflexus: <entryFree id="n2223" type="hapax" key="amflexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amflexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [qs. from amflecto], <sense id="n2223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curved round</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora grandi circuitu amflexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amfractus: <entryFree id="n2224" type="main" key="amfractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amfractus</orth>, v. anfr-.</entryFree>
amia: <entryFree id="n2225" type="greek" key="a^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tunny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(piscem) amiam vocant cujus etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>.—The form amias: <case>acc.</case> amian, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 47</bibl> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
amiantus: <entryFree id="n2226" type="greek" key="a^mi^antus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mi/antos</foreign> (unspotted, pure), <sense id="n2226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the amianth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stone which may be separated into threads and spun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and is inconsumable by fire; asbestos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earth-flax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 31, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amica: <entryFree id="n2227" type="main" key="a^mi_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīca</orth>, v 2. amicus.</entryFree>
amicabilis: <entryFree id="n2228" type="main" key="a^mi_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amicus</etym>, <sense id="n2228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amicable</hi> (post-class. and rare), Firm. Math. 5, 5.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a friendly manner</hi>, Jul. Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:63:section=211" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 63, § 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amicalis: <entryFree id="n2229" type="main" key="a^mi_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">friendly</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">affectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:10:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 10, § 7</bibl></cit>: transactio, Cod. 6, 58, 15, § 5: Deus hospitalis, amicalis, App. de Mundo, p. 75, 9.</sense></entryFree>
amicarius: <entryFree id="n2230" type="gloss" key="a^mi_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>amica</etym>, <sense id="n2230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that procures a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a procurer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
amice: <entryFree id="n2231" type="main" key="a^mi_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. amicus <sense id="n2231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amicimen: <entryFree id="n2232" type="main" key="a^mi^ci_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭcīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>amicio</etym>, <sense id="n2232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment</hi>, = amictus (only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">candidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 268, 32.</sense></entryFree>
amicinum: <entryFree id="n2233" type="gloss" key="amicinum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amicinum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n2233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the neck of a winesack</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll. (<hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> by mistake; cf. amicinus: <foreign lang="greek">a)skou= sto/ma</foreign>, Gloss.).</sense></entryFree>
amicio: <entryFree id="n2234" type="main" key="a^mi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăm-ĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭcui, or ixi, ictum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n2234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> amicibor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> only in exs. below; <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> amicisse, Front.) [jacio], <hi rend="ital">to throw round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wrap about</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)mfiba/llw</foreign>); exclusively of upper garments (on the contr., <hi rend="ital">induere</hi>, of clothes put or drawn on; <hi rend="ital">vestire</hi>, of those for the protection or ornament of the body): se amicire or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> amiciri, <hi rend="ital">to throw round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil one's self.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2234.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus epicroco, Naev. ap. Var. 7, 3, 92: palliolatim amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicibor gloriose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium, quo amictus, soccos, quibus indutus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus est pallio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg.</bibl></cit> <cb n="AMIC" /> 28, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus togā purpureā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: qui te togā praetextā amicuit, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 364</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">celerius mater amixit, Varr. ib.: dum calceabat ipse sese et amiciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: nube umeros (Gr. <case>acc.</case>) amictus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 516</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Psa. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier amicta sole,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 12, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">(rex) amicietur terrā Aegypti, sicut amicitur pastor pallio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:43:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jer. 43, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2234.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of other things, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nive amicta loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colus amicta lanā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitur vitibus ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et piper et quidquid chartis amicitur ineptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicta ossa luridā pelle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicti vitibus montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem alteram luce, alteram tenebris amicisse Jovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Fer. Als. p. 188" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Fer. Als. p. 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amiciter: <entryFree id="n2235" type="main" key="a^mi_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. amicus <sense id="n2235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amicitia: <entryFree id="n2236" type="main" key="a^mi_ci^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n2236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> amicitiāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 83</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> amicitiem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1019" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1019</bibl> Lachm.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 94</bibl> P., and Neue, Formenl. I. p. 372) [amicus], <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi> (very freq. in Cic., occurring more than 200 times). </sense><sense id="n2236.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Est autem amicitia nihil aliud nisi omnium divinarum humanarumque rerum cum benevolentiā et caritate summa consensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 6</bibl></cit>: eo ego ingenio natus sum: amicitiam atque inimicitiam in frontem promptam gero, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 129, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu ego huic bene et hic mihi volumus, et amicitia est antiqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Per te deos oro et nostram amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperata voluptas Suavis amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula amicitiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 83</bibl></cit>. The expressions usually connected with it are: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia exardescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi amicitia cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia est inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in amicitiā cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1019" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1019</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 34, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre se ad amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedere se amicitiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere ad amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitias incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiā alicujus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervenire in intimam amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manere in amicitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam violare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere jura amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditus evertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissociare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere, dissuere, discindere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirumpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficere ab amicitiā alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiare amicitiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renunciare amicitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n2236.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2236.3" n="A" level="2"> In the histt., <hi rend="ital">a league of friendship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an alliance</hi> between different nations, = foedus: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii, qui amicitiam fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam populi Romani colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam Populi Romani venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges bello victos in amicitiam recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus et amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 104:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 104, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia et foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 104:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 104, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia ac societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae urbes in amicitiā permanserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias cum aliquo facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:20:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 2 Par. 20, 35</bibl></cit> al. —</sense><sense id="n2236.4" n="B" level="2"> In botany, of plants, <hi rend="ital">sympathy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutae cum flco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter has vitium amicitiā accipitur ulmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 17, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2236.5" n="C" level="2"> In post-Aug. Lat., <hi rend="ital">abstr. pro concr.</hi> = amici: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitem nisi ex amicitiā domini quam rarissime recipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 23</bibl></cit> (cf. before: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitem nisi amicum familiaremque domini necessarium receperit): quin et parte ejusdem epistulae increpuit amicitias muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes amicitias et familiaritates intra breve tempus adflixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amicities: <entryFree id="n2237" type="hapax" key="a^mi_ci^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2237.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
amico: <entryFree id="n2238" type="hapax" key="a^mi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>amicus</etym>, <sense id="n2238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make friendly to one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oeclides solitā prece numen amicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:470" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 470</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amicosus: <entryFree id="n2239" type="gloss" key="a^mi_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rich</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in friends</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P. <cb n="AMIC" /></sense></entryFree>
amictorius: <entryFree id="n2240" type="main" key="a^micto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămictōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amicio</etym>, <sense id="n2240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for throwing about</hi> one: linteamen, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 48, § 1.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămic-tōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garment which is thrown about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">a light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose garment</hi>, esp. of women, <hi rend="ital">a scarf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tie for the neck</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 48; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Isa. 2, 3, v. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amictus: <entryFree id="n2241" type="main" key="a^mictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of amicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2242" type="main" key="a^mictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>amicio</etym>, orig. <sense id="n2242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi> one of a garment; hence, </sense><sense id="n2242.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The manner of dressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictum imitari alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 91</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid in amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2242.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, abstr. pro concr., <hi rend="ital">the garment itself that is thrown about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mantle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (statuam) esse ejusdem, status, amictus, anulus, imago ipsa declarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra jam vestes, frustra mutatur amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut amictum mutabis eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex,</quote> <trans><tr>made of a double texture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 19, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amictu ora velabis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Ez. 24, 17</bibl></cit>: gloriam dedit sanctitatis amictum, <hi rend="ital">the garment of holiness</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the sacred vestment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccli. 50, 12</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2242.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2242.4" n="1" level="3"> For <hi rend="ital">other kinds of covering</hi>: caeli mutemus amictum, <hi rend="ital">the air which surrounds us</hi>, i. e. to go into another region, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulae amictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:631" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 631</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:613" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam virides lacerate comas, jam scindite amictus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the herbage that clothes the ground</tr>, <tr>weeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:70" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 70</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n2242.5" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem mater amictum dedit, sollicite custodire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not to give up the habits formed in early youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amicula: <entryFree id="n2243" type="main" key="a^mi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcŭla</orth>, v. amiculus.</entryFree>
amiculum: <entryFree id="n2244" type="main" key="a^mi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>amicio</etym>, <sense id="n2244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment that one throws about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mantle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloak</hi>: amiculum genus est vestimenti, a circumjectu dictum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 28</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicae amictus amiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agreste duplex amiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquem videret minus bene vestitum, suum amiculum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cim. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: toga picta plerumque amiculo erat accum benti, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem familiae tuam purpureum amiculum habe re non sines?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum homini sapientiam colenti amiculum est gloriae cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Eloqu. p. 78" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Eloqu. p. 78</bibl></cit> Nieb.</sense></entryFree>
amiculus: <entryFree id="n2245" type="main" key="a^mi_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>amicus</etym>, <sense id="n2245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dear friend</hi>: quid de Docimo amiculo meo? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nil miseret, dure, tui dulcis amiculi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 2</bibl></cit>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dear</hi> (<hi rend="ital">female</hi>) <hi rend="ital">friend</hi>: de amiculà rixatus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 244</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amicus: <entryFree id="n2246" type="main" key="a^mi_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămēcus</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 15</bibl> Müll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amo</etym>, <sense id="n2246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amicable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liking;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case>, Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">410: animo esse amico erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni sunt nobis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo amicus nobis jam inde a puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium tibi valde amicum esse cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus non magis tyranno quam tyrannidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male numen amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 735</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:834" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 834</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Fortuna) amica varietati constantiam respuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica luto sus,</quote> <trans><tr>fond of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nemo est amicior Attico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicior Cilicum aerariis quam nostro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deiotarum, fidelissimum regem atque amicissimum rei publicae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summi viri, tum amicissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successor conjunctissimus et amicissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc libro ad amicum amicissimus de amicitiā scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">23, 88</bibl> (but the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> may sometimes be rendered as belonging to 2. amicus, <hi rend="ital">a greater friend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the greatest friend</hi>, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl>, and Am. 1, 5; so in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">basileu/s</foreign> etc.).—</sense><sense id="n2246.1" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Cic. rarely): nihil homini amico est opportuno amicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum te nihil est mihi amicius solitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus intramus amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: fessos opibus solatur amicis, id. <pb n="106" /> <cb n="AMIC" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 416</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento amico ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per amica silentia lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol amicum tempus agens,</quote> <trans><tr>bringing the welcome hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus fraudibus amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas postulatur, qui mihimet ipsi amicissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 34</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n2246.2" n="C" level="2"> Amicum est mihi (after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fi/lon e)sti/ moi</foreign>; in pure Lat., mihi cordi est, etc.); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it pleases me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it accords with my feelings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dis amicum est nec mihi te prius Obire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in a friendly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amicably</hi>. </sense><sense id="n2246.3" n="a" level="4"> Old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcĭter</orth>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 510, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2246.4" n="b" level="4"> Class. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">facis amice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec accipienda amice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26</bibl>. —* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 1, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2247" type="main" key="a^mi_cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from amo, as <foreign lang="greek">fi/los</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">file/w</foreign>, and <foreign /> from <foreign /></etym> (<sense id="n2247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> amicūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 24</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n2247.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A friend;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poss. adj.;</hi> v. Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">410: est is (amicus) tamquam alter idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 21, 80</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">amicum qui intuetur, tamquam exemplar intuetur sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Non tam utilitas parta per amicum, quam amici amor ipse delectat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: Amicus certus in re incertā cernitur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 17, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni improbis, improbi bonis amici esse non possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ib. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus saeculis vix tria aut quattuor nominantur paria amicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ex amicis certis mi es certissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit> and 57: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus verbum hoc est, Communia esse amicorum inter se omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Respicis antiquum lassis in rebus amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:93" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alba tuus antiquissimus non solum amicus, verum etiam amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitis et amici mei M. Pacuvii fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis incommodis graviter angi non amicum sed se ipsum amantis est,</quote> <trans><tr>of one loving not his friend</tr>, <tr>but himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab amicis honesta petere, amicorum causā honesta facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternus amicus ac pernecessarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus novus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici ac familiares veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequaevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici jucundissimi et omnium horarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus propior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 21, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secernere blandum amicum a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici tristes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferioris ordinis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communes amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amice, salve!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 6</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 20, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimi veritatis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos parare optimam vitae, ut ita dicam, supellectilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus amicorum habens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me unum atque unicum amicum habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 73, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">amicos habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 11, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 22, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos sibi amicos junget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum servare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum servare per durum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo uti amico,</quote> <trans><tr>to have one as a friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi amicum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 430</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 13, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico inservire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico parcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et monendi amici saepe sunt et objurgandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 24, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico ignoscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angorem pro amico capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici jacentem animum excitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum consolari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico orbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Am. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum offendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non paucis munitus amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Also for patronus, <hi rend="ital">patron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector;</hi> so Horace of Mæcenas, Epod. 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus potens,</quote> <trans><tr>powerful friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:313" default="NO">6, 313</bibl>: Suet. <cb n="AMIT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:56" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib. 35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35</bibl></cit>.—And for socius, <hi rend="ital">companion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepido fugam exprobravit amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2247.2" n="B" level="2"> In polit. relations, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the State</hi> (who was not always socius, <hi rend="ital">an ally</hi>, but the socius was always amicus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia): Deiotarus ex animo amicus, unus fidelis populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socio atque amico regi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2247.3" n="C" level="2"> In and after the Aug. per., <hi rend="ital">a counsellor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minister of a prince</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 2</bibl> Dähn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt multi reges ex amicis Alexandri Magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Reg. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; 56; 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 7 al.</bibl>; cf. Ernest. ad Suet. Excurs. XV.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămī-ca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n2247.4" n="A" level="2"> In bon. part., <hi rend="ital">a female friend</hi> (very rare; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e(tai/ra</foreign> in Hom., Aristoph., Plato): <cit><quote lang="la">amicae, cognatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at haec amicae erunt, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Me (laedit) soror et cum quae dormit amica simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibit ad adfectam, quae non languebit, amicam Visere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:353" default="NO">6, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:455" default="NO">6, 455</bibl>; 6, 481; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 865, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">891, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2247.5" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., = meretrix, <hi rend="ital">a concubine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesan</hi> (esp. freq. in the comic poets; so in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(tai/ra</foreign> com. in Att. usage): eum suus pater ab amicā abduxit, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem pejorem quam haec amica est Phaedromi non vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 39 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ista uxor sive amica est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 6</bibl>; 4, 6, 15 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:144" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amilcar: <entryFree id="n2248" type="main" key="Amilcar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amilcar</orth>, v. Hamilcar.</entryFree>
aminaeus: <entryFree id="n2249" type="main" key="A^mi_naeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīnaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ē^us</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)aminai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n2249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Aminœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a region in the country of the Piceni</hi>, distinguished for the culture of the vine: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 97</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl> Schneid.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:3" default="NO">3, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3678</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amisia: <entryFree id="n2250" type="main" key="A^mi_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīsĭa</orth>, ae. <sense id="n2250.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a river in Germany</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Ems</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3</bibl>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīsĭus</orth>, ii; cf. Mann. Germ. 419. —</sense><sense id="n2250.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fortress built by the Romans upon the Ems</hi> (near the Fort Delf Zyl, in West Friesland), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl>; cf. Mann. Germ. 82.</sense></entryFree>
amissibilis: <entryFree id="n2251" type="main" key="a_missi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmissĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amitto</etym>, <sense id="n2251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be lost</hi> (only in eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 5, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib. 15:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 13</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
amissio: <entryFree id="n2252" type="main" key="a_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a losing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a loss</hi> (several times in Cic., elsewh. rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni, rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4</bibl></cit>: duorum luminum, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> (my) <hi rend="ital">two eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 16, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 27, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rom. 11, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amissus: <entryFree id="n2253" type="main" key="a_missus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of amitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2254" type="hapax" key="a_missus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmissus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for amissio, <sense id="n2254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loss.</hi> Siciliae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amisus: <entryFree id="n2255" type="main" key="A^mi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amiso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pontus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Samsoon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>. Cf. Mann. Asia Min. 2, 448 sq.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămīsēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Amisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amita: <entryFree id="n2256" type="main" key="a^mi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. abba, avus, and Engl. aunt</etym> (so the mother's sister is called matertera, from mater; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl>), <sense id="n2256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a father's sister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paternal aunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 20, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n2256.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n2256.2" n="A" level="2"> Amita magna, <hi rend="ital">a sister of a grandfather</hi> (avi), <hi rend="ital">a great-aunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl>; Paul. l. c.—</sense><sense id="n2256.3" n="B" level="2"> Amita major, <hi rend="ital">an aunt of a grandfather</hi>, Paul. l. c. and Fest. s. v. Major, p. 98.—</sense><sense id="n2256.4" n="C" level="2"> Amita maxima, <hi rend="ital">an aunt of a great-grandfather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> abamita, Paul. l. c. and Fest. s. v. Major, p. 98.</sense></entryFree>
amiternum: <entryFree id="n2257" type="main" key="A^mi^ternum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămĭternum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 5, 12</bibl>, from am- = amb- and Aternus</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ami/ternon</foreign>, <sense id="n2257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town built by the Aborigines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Sabine country</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">San Vettorino;</hi> cf. Mann. Ital. 1, 509; the birthplace of the historian Sallust.—Derivv. </sense><sense id="n2257.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămĭternīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Amiternum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:422" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 422</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămĭ-ternīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:28, p. 11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 28, p. 11</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2257.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămĭternus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <cb n="AMMO" /> <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Amiterninus: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amitinum: <entryFree id="n2258" type="main" key="A^mi^ti_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămĭtīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n2258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amitinus: <entryFree id="n2259" type="main" key="a^mi^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amita</etym>, <sense id="n2259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descended from a father's sister;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭtī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămĭtīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">cousins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cousins-german</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1</bibl> and 10.</sense></entryFree>
amitto: <entryFree id="n2260" type="main" key="a_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (amīsti, sync., = amisisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 9</bibl>: <sense id="n2260.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">amīssis, sync., = amiseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 70</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n2260.1" n="I. 1. A." level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to send away from</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">to dismiss</hi> (thus, anteclass., freq. in Plaut. and Ter.): quod nos dicimus dimittere, antiqui etiam dicebant amittere, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 71</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 75, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulte feci, qui hunc (servum) amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 25</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto hic servos suum erum hinc amittat domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et te et hunc amittam hinc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 8, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque mi jus sit amittendi nec retinendi copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 17 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis mecum est anulus, quem amiserat,</quote> <trans><tr>which he had sent away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 83, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2260.2" n="B" level="2"> Spec., <hi rend="ital">to let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let slip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedā de manibus amissā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam ex oculis manibusque amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 32</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sceledre, manibus amisisti praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 47</bibl></cit> Ritschl.—</sense><sense id="n2260.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2260.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">istam rem certum est non amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi hanc amittam noxiam unam,</quote> <trans><tr>to remit</tr>, <tr>to pardon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18 al.</bibl> (opp. occasionem raptare, Cic.: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere, Liv.: complecti, Plin. Min.: intellegere, Tac.): servire tempori et non amittere tempus cum sit datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to break their word given on oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Eun. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eun. 10, 2</bibl></cit> Dähn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:556 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 556 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2260.5" n="B" level="2"> Of trees, <hi rend="ital">to let go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">punica florem amittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyrus et amygdala amittunt florem et primos fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocissime salix amittit semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2260.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to lose</hi> (commonly without criminality, by mistake, accident, etc.; while <hi rend="ital">perdere</hi> usually designates a losing through one's own fault; and <hi rend="ital">omittere</hi>, to allow a thing to pass by or over, which one might have obtained): Decius amisit vitam; at non perdidit: dedit vitam, accepit patriam: amisit animam, potitus est gloriā, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 44, 57</bibl>: Multa amittuntur tarditie et socordiā, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 73 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Simul consilium cum re amisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittit vitam sensumque priorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 769</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii jus amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totam litem aut obtineamus aut amittamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes optimae amissae et perditae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium amisit (sc. per mortem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Capsam et magnam pecuniam amiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimoniis amissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittere optimates, i. e. favorem, animum eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 7, 2</bibl></cit> Dähn.: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera amissa (sc. incendio) restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>;
