amotio: <entryFree id="n2301" type="main" key="a_mo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amoveo</etym>, <sense id="n2301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a removing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">removal</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">only twice in Cic.): doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amotus: <entryFree id="n2302" type="main" key="a_mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">āmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of amoveo.</entryFree>
amoveo: <entryFree id="n2303" type="main" key="a_mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ā-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remove from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi> (esp. with effort or trouble; syn.: dimoveo, abduco, averto, arceo, repello): proprie amovetur saxum de loco, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amoveamus lapidem de ore putei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 29, 8</bibl></cit>; v. amolior. </sense><sense id="n2303.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): me exinde amovit loco. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubi erit empta, ut aliquo ex urbe (eam) amoveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem hanc quom abs te amoveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Age, tamen ego hunc amovebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ex istis locis amove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes amoverunt eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Porcia virgas ab omnium civium corpore amovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ille est amotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoto custode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amotis longius ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia amovimus ab hostium oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imagines ex bibliothecis amovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>.—Hence: se amovere, <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hinc amove,</quote> <trans><tr>off with you!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e coetu se amovissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui memet finibus umquam amōrim Ausoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:224" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit repente recedere seque e medio quam longissime amovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of abstract ideas, <hi rend="ital">to put away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast off</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitiem amove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socordiamque ex pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crapulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoto metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istum amorem ex animo amoveas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amove malitiam a carne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccl. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoto quaeramus seria ludo,</quote> <trans><tr>jesting aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 27 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to take with itself</hi>: quaecumque vetustate amovet aetas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 225</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2303.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n2303.3" n="A" level="2"> In and after the Aug. per., <hi rend="ital">to take away by stealth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal</hi> (euphemist. for furari, furtum facere): <cit><quote lang="la">boves Per dolum amotas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si filia familiares res amoverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex heredidate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:70 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 2, 70 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2303.4" n="B" level="2"> In post-Aug. prose (perh. only in Tac.), <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amotus Cercinam quattuordecim annis exilium toleravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulationis suspectos per nomen obsidum amovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 9</bibl></cit>; 14, 57.</sense></entryFree>
ampelinus: <entryFree id="n2304" type="greek" key="ampe^li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mpe/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n2304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the vine</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 548, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampelitis: <entryFree id="n2305" type="greek" key="ampe^li_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕlītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mpeli=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n2305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bituminous earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with which the vine was sprinkled in order to keep off worms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 56, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampelodesmos: <entryFree id="n2306" type="greek" key="ampe^lo^desmo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕlŏdesmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mpelo/desmos</foreign>, <sense id="n2306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant used for tying up vines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampeloleuce: <entryFree id="n2307" type="greek" key="ampe^lo^leuce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕlŏleucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mpeloleu/kh</foreign> (<sense id="n2307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white vine</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the white vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bryony</hi>: Bryonia alba, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampeloprason: <entryFree id="n2308" type="main" key="ampe^lopra^son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕloprăson</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mpelo/prason</foreign>, <sense id="n2308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably field-garlic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampelos: <entryFree id="n2309" type="main" key="ampe^lo^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampĕlŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/mpelos</foreign>, <sense id="n2309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grape-vine</hi> (used technically; in pure Lat. vitis). </sense><sense id="n2309.1" n="I" level="1"> Ampelos agria, <hi rend="ital">wild vine</hi> (in pure Lat. labrusca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 14, § 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2309.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="AMPH" /> Ampelos chironia, <hi rend="ital">greasewort;</hi> in pure Lat. vitis nigra or bryonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 4, 16, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2310" type="main" key="Ampe^lo^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ampĕlŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n2310.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2310.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A headland and town in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2311" type="main" key="Ampe^lo^s3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ampĕlŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beautiful youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loved by Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:409" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 409</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampendices: <entryFree id="n2312" type="gloss" key="ampendi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampendĭces</orth>, <sense id="n2312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appendages</hi>, so called by the ancients, acc. to Festus, quod circumpenderent, quos nunc appendices appellamus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
amphemerinos: <entryFree id="n2313" type="greek" key="amphe_me^ri^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphēmĕrĭnŏs</orth>, <itype>a, on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a\mfhmerinos</foreign>, <sense id="n2313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daily</hi> (in pure Lat. cotidianus): <cit><quote lang="la">genus febrium,</quote> <trans><tr>not intermittent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 66, § 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphiaraus: <entryFree id="n2314" type="main" key="Amphi^a^ra_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭărāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfia/raos</foreign>, <sense id="n2314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Grecian seer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Alcmœon and Amphilochus.</hi> Knowing that he was doomed to lose his life in the Theban war, he concealed himself in his house; <cit><quote lang="la">but his wife, Eriphyle, was prevailed upon to betray him by the offer of a golden necklace, and he was compelled by Polynices to accompany him to the war, where he was swallowed up, with his chariot, in the earth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2314.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n2314.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭărēus</orth> (five syll.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Amphiarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae Amphiariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2314.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭă-rāīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Amphiaraus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Alcmœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 43</bibl> (al. Amphĭărēïădes).</sense></entryFree>
amphibolia: <entryFree id="n2315" type="greek" key="amphi^bo^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭbŏlĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭbŏlŏgĭa</orth>, in <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 243</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 444</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 33</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfiboli/a</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">a)mfibologi/a</foreign>); <sense id="n2315.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in rhet.,</quote> <trans><tr>ambiguity</tr>, <tr>double-meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 32</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:1 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
amphibolus: <entryFree id="n2316" type="greek" key="amphi^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭbŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/bolos</foreign>, <sense id="n2316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ambiguous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphibrachys: <entryFree id="n2317" type="greek" key="amphi^bra^chys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭbrăchys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/braxus</foreign> (short before and after); in metre, <sense id="n2317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the foot</hi> ˘¯˘, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl> (later gramm. sometimes give the word the Latin ending, amphibrachus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 105</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
amphibrevis: <entryFree id="n2318" type="hapax" key="amphi^bre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭbrĕvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for amphibrachys, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.</entryFree>
amphictyones: <entryFree id="n2319" type="main" key="Amphicty^o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphictyŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. -ăs; <sense id="n2319.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfiktu/ones</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the political and religious assembly of the confederated Greek States at Thermopylœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later at Delphi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Amphictyons</hi> (cf. Tittm. Amphyct. Bund, Heeren Ideen, 3, 196): <cit><quote lang="la">Thebani accusantur apud Amphictyonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreto Amphictyonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphidamas: <entryFree id="n2320" type="main" key="Amphi^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭdămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfida/mas</foreign>, <sense id="n2320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Alĕus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:376" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 376</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphilochia: <entryFree id="n2321" type="main" key="Amphi^lo^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭlŏchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfiloxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n2321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small province in Acarnania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40</bibl>; Mann. Gr. 62 sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭlŏchĭ-us</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭlŏchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Amphilochian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argos Amphilochium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argos Amphilochicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭlŏchi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Amphilochia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphilochus: <entryFree id="n2322" type="main" key="Amphi^lo^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭlŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfi/loxos</foreign>. <sense id="n2322.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Amphiarāus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of</hi> Argos Amphilochium, <hi rend="ital">in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2322.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Alcmœon and Manto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a seer had a temple at Oropus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphimacrus: <entryFree id="n2323" type="greek" key="amphi^ma_^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭmā^crus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/makros</foreign> (long before and after), <sense id="n2323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amphimacer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the poetical foot</hi> ¯˘¯ <cit><quote lang="la">(also called Creticus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphimallum: <entryFree id="n2324" type="greek" key="amphi^mallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭmallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/mallon</foreign> (hairy on both sides), <sense id="n2324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woollen cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was hairy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaggy on both sides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphimedon: <entryFree id="n2325" type="main" key="Amphi^me^do_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭmĕdōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfime/dwn</foreign>, <sense id="n2325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Libyan who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while fighting for Cepheus against Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was slain by the latter.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphinomus: <entryFree id="n2326" type="main" key="Amphi^no^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭnŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfi/nomos</foreign>, <sense id="n2326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a youth of Catana who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with his brother Anapis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saved his parents upon his shoulders from the flames of Ætna; on account of which monuments were erected to both of them by their fellow-citizens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:197" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl>, ext. 4.</sense></entryFree>
amphion: <entryFree id="n2327" type="main" key="Amphi_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n2327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Antiope by Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Niobe;</hi> renowned for his music. <cb n="AMPH" /> by the magical power of which the stones came together for the building of the walls of Thebes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 6</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 394</bibl>. He killed himself on account of grief for the loss of his children, who had been slain by the arrows of Apollo and Diana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphionis arces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:427" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 427</bibl></cit>.—Whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Amphionian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphioniae lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphipolis: <entryFree id="n2328" type="main" key="Amphi^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfi/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n2328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished city in Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Neokhorio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n2328.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n2328.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭpŏlītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfipoli/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an Amphipolitan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2328.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphĭpŏlītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Amphipolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
amphiprostylos: <entryFree id="n2329" type="greek" key="amphi^prosty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭprostȳlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfipro/stulos</foreign> (with pillars before and behind), <sense id="n2329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple which had pillars in front and rear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but not at the sides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphisbaena: <entryFree id="n2330" type="greek" key="amphisbaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphisbaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfi/sbaina</foreign>, <sense id="n2330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of serpent in Libya which can move either backwards or forwards</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 719</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphissa: <entryFree id="n2331" type="main" key="Amphissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/amfissa</foreign>. <sense id="n2331.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The ancient chieftown in Locri Ozolœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Phocis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Salona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 172</bibl>; cf. Mann. Gr. 125.—</sense><sense id="n2331.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory of Locri Epizephyrii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lower Italy;</hi> whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphissi-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Amphissa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphissia saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 703</bibl></cit> Riese, where Merkel reads <hi rend="ital">Amphrisia</hi>, the designation of a place now unknown.</sense></entryFree>
amphissus: <entryFree id="n2332" type="main" key="Amphissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphissus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Apollo and Dryope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">builder of the town Œta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Mt. Œta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 356</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphitane: <entryFree id="n2333" type="main" key="amphi^ta^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭtănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n2333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> chrysocolla, perh. a magnetic pyrites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphitapa: <entryFree id="n2334" type="greek" key="amphi^ta^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭtăpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfita/phs</foreign>, <sense id="n2334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy on both sides</hi>: dormire super amphitapa bene molli, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 30</bibl>; Lucil. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphithalamos: <entryFree id="n2335" type="greek" key="amphi^tha^la^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭthălămŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfiqa/lamos</foreign>, <sense id="n2335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an antechamber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (cubiculorum) unum thalamos, alterum amphithalamos dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit> Rose and Müll. (al. antithalamus, a chamber opp. to the sleeping-chamber).</sense></entryFree>
amphitheatralis: <entryFree id="n2336" type="main" key="amphi^the^a_tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭthĕātrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amphitheatrum</etym>, <sense id="n2336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the amphitheatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amphitheatrical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:70" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 293</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphitheatricus: <entryFree id="n2337" type="main" key="amphi^the^a_tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭthĕātrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, i.q. amphitheatralis: charta, <sense id="n2337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made near the amphitheatre</hi>, of little value, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphitheatrum: <entryFree id="n2338" type="greek" key="amphi^the^a_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphĭthĕātrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mfiqe/atron</foreign>, <sense id="n2338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amphitheatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circular or oval building in which each successive seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised above the last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished an unobstructed view.</hi> From its shape it was sometimes called <hi rend="ital">circus.</hi> In Rome it was used for public spectacles: for combats of wild beasts and of ships, but most frequently for gladiatorial shows. It was at first built of wood, but afterwards of stone, and with great splendor. The largest one, designed by Augustus, but begun by Vespasian and finished by Titus, was called the <hi rend="ital">Amphitheatrum Florium</hi>, or, since the time of Bede, the <hi rend="ital">Colosseum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Colisœum</hi>, perhaps from the Colossus of Nero, which stood close by. This is said to have held eighty-seven thousand spectators, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 15, 2, 35, p. 471 al.</bibl>; cf. Smith, Class. Dict.</sense></entryFree>
amphitrite: <entryFree id="n2339" type="main" key="Amphi_tri_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphītrītē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfitri/th</foreign>, <sense id="n2339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Amphitrite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and goddess of the Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:201" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 201</bibl>; hence an appel. for <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amphitryo: <entryFree id="n2340" type="main" key="Amphi_^try^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphī^tryo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŭo</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfitru/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n2340.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Alceus and Hipponome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Alcmene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 112</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphī^try-ōnĭădēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">patr. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Amphitryo</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 214</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2340.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a comedy of Plautus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amphora: <entryFree id="n2341" type="main" key="ampho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphŏra</orth>,, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n2341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> as a measure, usually amphorūm, v infra, II.; cf. Charis. <pb n="110" /> <cb n="AMPL" /> p. 41 P.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mforeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually made of clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with two handles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ears;</hi> for liquids, esp. wine, <hi rend="ital">a flagon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitcher. flask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jar</hi>, etc.; cf. Smith, Dict. Antiq. </sense><sense id="n2341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras implere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora coepit Institui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">Also for holding wine: amphora vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Dan. 14, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">oil: amphorae oleariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">honey: aut pressa puris mella condit amphoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">water: amphoram aquae portans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for the <hi rend="ital">wine</hi> contained therein, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2341.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A measure for liquids</hi> (also called quadrantal; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll.), = 2 urnae, or 8 congii, etc. = 6 gals. 7 pts.: <cit><quote lang="la">in singulas vini amphoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 93</bibl>. Since such a measure was kept as a standard at the Capitolium, amphora Capitolina signifies <hi rend="ital">an amphora of the full measure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2341.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The measure of a ship</hi> (as the <hi rend="ital">ton</hi> with us): naves, quarum minor nulla erat duūm milium amphorūm, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem, quae plus quam CCC. amphorarum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphoralis: <entryFree id="n2342" type="hapax" key="ampho^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amphora</etym>, <sense id="n2342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing the measure of an amphora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphorarius: <entryFree id="n2343" type="main" key="ampho^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amphŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contained in the amphora</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>kept therein</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amphrisius: <entryFree id="n2344" type="main" key="Amphri_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphrīsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Amphissa, II.</entryFree>
amphrysus: <entryFree id="n2345" type="main" key="Amphry_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amphrȳsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amfruso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n2345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in the Thessalian province of Phthiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near which Apollo fed the flocks of Admetus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 580</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2345.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n2345.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Am-phrȳsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Amphrysus</hi>, or, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">to Apollo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 398</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2345.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Am-phrȳsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:105" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ample: <entryFree id="n2346" type="main" key="ample_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amplus <sense id="n2346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amplector: <entryFree id="n2347" type="main" key="amplector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">am-plector</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amploctor</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 552, 39</bibl> P.), <itype>exus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n2347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplecto</orth>, Liv. And. Od. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 379</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.; Struve, 114.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 27</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.). </sense><sense id="n2347.1" n="I. A." level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twine round</hi> a person or thing (aliquem, <foreign lang="greek">ple/kesqai a)mfi/tina</foreign>; hence with reference to the other object; cf. adimo), <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle;</hi> of living beings, <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): genua amplectens, Liv. And. Od. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 379</bibl> P. (as transl. of Hom. Od. 6, 142: <foreign lang="greek">gou/nwn labw/n</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">amplectimur tibi genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsanguem (patrem) amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem Augusti amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam Herculis aram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens arboris amplectens stirpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum tellus amplectitur ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>to grasp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimento amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">amplectitur intra se insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexa jugerum soli quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et molli circum est ansas amplexus acantho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes amplecti muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 209</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">visne ego te ac tute me amplectare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille me amplexus atque osculans flere prohibebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Somn. Scip. 3</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 14</bibl>, where Orell. reads <hi rend="ital">complexus</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n2347.2" n="B" level="2"> Of space, <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium amplexus ad vim remigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor milia passuum ambitu amplexus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus naturae amplectens pontum terrasque jacentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 536</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2347.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2347.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embrace</hi> in mind or knowledge, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo rei magnitudinem amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quas (artes) si quis unus complexus omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si judex non amplectetur omnia consilio, non animo ac mente circumspiciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 7</bibl></cit>; also simply <hi rend="ital">to reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem toto pectore amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2347.5" n="B" level="2"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego argumentum pluribus verbis amplecterer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio verbis causam et rationem juris amplectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes res per scripturam amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: non ego <cb n="AMPL" /> cuncta meis amplecti versibus opto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius Ponti forma breviter amplectenda est, ut facilius partes noscantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl></cit>.—Also of a name, <hi rend="ital">to comprehend</hi> under: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem interdum virtutis nomine amplectimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis universam et propriam oratoris vim definire complectique vult,</quote> <trans><tr>to define the peculiar function of the orator and include the whole of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 64</bibl></cit>; so of a law, <hi rend="ital">to include</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed neque haec (verba) in principem aut principis parentem, quos lex majestatis amplectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2347.6" n="C" level="2"> Of study, learning, <hi rend="ital">to include</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embrace</hi>: neque eam tamen scientiam, quam adjungis oratori, complexus es, <hi rend="ital">but yet have notincluded</hi> in your attainments <hi rend="ital">that knowledge which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quod si tantam rerum maximarum arte suā rhetorici illi doctores complecterentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2347.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To embrace in heart</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem mihi videtur amplecti res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis amplecti plebem videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem amicissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc se amplectitur uno, i. e. se amat,</quote> <trans><tr>esteems himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tanto amore possessiones suas amplexi tenebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. repudiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplecti virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatem et dignitates hominum amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: mens hominis amplectitur maxime cognitionem, <hi rend="ital">delights in understanding</hi>, id. Ac. pr. 2, 10, 31: (episcopum) amplectentem eum fidelem sermonem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 1, 9</bibl>: amplexus civitates (sc. animo), <hi rend="ital">having fixed his mind on</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">intending to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam rei publicae amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 93</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so playfully of one who robs the State treasury: rem publicam nimium amplecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2347.8" n="E" level="2"> In circumlocution: magnam Brigantium partem aut victoriā amplexus est aut bello, <hi rend="ital">embraced in conquest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">conquered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amplexor: <entryFree id="n2348" type="main" key="amplexor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplexor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n2348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. freq.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplexo</orth>, <itype>analog to amplecto</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 60</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 11</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl>) [amplector], <hi rend="ital">to embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi> (more rare than the simple verb; for the most part only anteclass., and in Cic. and eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n2348.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram amplexantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebit praedam et amplexabitur,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in love, at greeting, parting, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 40</bibl>: mitto jam osculari atque amplexari, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicum meum, sic amplexabantur, sic fovebant, sic osculabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arsinoë corpore suo puerorum corpora amplexata protexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexatus est eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">45, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Jud. 19, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2348.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius totum me amplexatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 98</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 14</bibl>: species (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">i)de/as</foreign>) mirifice Plato erat amplexatus, i. e. adamaverat, suas fecerat, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae amplexamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amplexus: <entryFree id="n2349" type="main" key="amplexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of amplector.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n2350" type="main" key="amplexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>amplector</etym>, <sense id="n2350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an embracing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounding</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n2350.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: amplexu terrarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 319</bibl>: serpentis amplexu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuit amplexus,</quote> <trans><tr>my embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat (serpens) hos morsu, longis amplexibus illos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanus, qui orbem terrarum amplexu finit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:255 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 255 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2350.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n2350.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A loving embrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caress</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum dabit amplexus atque oscula dulcia figet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 687</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter amplexus flevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:46:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 46, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem impedire amplexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum petis amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 69</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 522" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 522</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: amplexu petere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe fieri ab amplexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusus amplexibus Tiberii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere aliquem amplexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amplexus alicujus ruere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amplexus ejus effusus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2350.4" n="B" level="2"> Euphemist., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 399</bibl> Drak.</sense></entryFree>
ampliatio: <entryFree id="n2351" type="main" key="ampli^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amplio</etym>. * <sense id="n2351.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An extending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarging</hi>: addita est sacramento,<cb n="AMPL" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2351.1" n="II" level="1"> In law t. t., <hi rend="ital">a deferring of the decision of the judge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliata est et ipsa ampliatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> Ascon. ad Cic. Verr. p. 164</bibl> Bait.; cf. amplio, II.</sense></entryFree>
amplificatio: <entryFree id="n2352" type="main" key="ampli^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amplifico</etym>, <sense id="n2352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a widening;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n2352.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An extending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increasing</hi> (perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2352.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an exaggerated description of an object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an amplification</hi>, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:99" default="NO">5, 10, 99</bibl>; v. amplifico, II.</sense></entryFree>
amplificator: <entryFree id="n2353" type="main" key="ampli^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who enlarges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an amplifier</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNICIPII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1025</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VRBIS ROMAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 282, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amplificatrix: <entryFree id="n2354" type="hapax" key="ampli^fi^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amplificator</etym>, <sense id="n2354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that enlarges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amplifies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplificatrix veri vetustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amplifice: <entryFree id="n2355" type="hapax" key="ampli^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amplificus.</entryFree>
amplifico: <entryFree id="n2356" type="main" key="ampli^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>amplusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n2356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to widen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (class., but mostly in prose). </sense><sense id="n2356.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressum domūs et atrii amplificavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 50, 5</bibl></cit>: dolorem, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <trans><tr>to strengthen</tr>, <tr>increase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 50, 5</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas amplificata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduorum auctoritatem apud omnes Belgas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amplificet Deus nomen Salomonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 1, 47</bibl></cit>. —Aliquem aliquā re: <cit><quote lang="la">(eos) festinatis honoribus amplificat atque auget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:69" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honore et gloriā amplificati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplificatus auro et argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2356.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to place a subject in some way in a clearer light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to amplify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilate upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa laus eloquentiae est amplificare rem ornando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 104</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 221</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2 al.</bibl>; v. amplificatio.</sense></entryFree>
amplificus: <entryFree id="n2357" type="hapax" key="ampli^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Or. 21" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Or. 21</bibl>, Fragm. 3, p. 259 Francof. —Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplifice vestis decorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 265</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amplio: <entryFree id="n2358" type="main" key="ampli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>amplus</etym>, <sense id="n2358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amplify</hi> (rare, esp. before the Aug. per.; mostly in prose). </sense><sense id="n2358.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amplianda scalpello plaga est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>: rem (familiarem), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ampliando numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliato vetere Apollinis templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2358.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>to render glorious</tr>, <tr>to ennoble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalis bellicis laudibus ampliatur virtus Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcritudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 10, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n2358.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp., judic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to delay judgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adjourn</hi>, in order to make further investigation (since the judges in such cases employed the expression AMPLIVS or NON LIQVET, v. amplius, c. and Rupert. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 38, 1, p. 455</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n2358.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas ampliandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex ampliandi facit potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2358.5" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of pers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to defer his business</hi>: istum hominem nefarium ampliaveritis, Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis ampliatus reus tertio absolutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2358.6" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing.</hi> causam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:16" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. ampliatio and comperendinatio.</sense></entryFree>
ampliter: <entryFree id="n2359" type="main" key="ampli^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amplus <sense id="n2359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amplitudo: <entryFree id="n2360" type="main" key="ampli^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amplus</etym>, in space, <sense id="n2360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wide extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breadth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">width</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amplitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulk</hi> (class., but only in prose). </sense><sense id="n2360.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum modicā amplitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum stadiorum LXX. amplitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus adolescit in amplitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo amplitudinis et artis eximiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margaritarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudines bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2360.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2360.3" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum splendor, amplitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum gestarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18</bibl></cit>: fortunae, Plin. praef. 3: <pb n="111" /> <cb n="AMPL" /> opum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4:5:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 31</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudines virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2360.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandeur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consequence</hi> (more general than dignitas, auctoritas, etc.; cf. Manut. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Hab. Syn. 363): amplitudo est potentiae aut majestatis aut aliquarum copiarum magna abundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:55:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 55, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, in quibus summa auctoritas est et amplitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas est amplitudo et dignitas civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam amplitudinem pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudinem suam retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudinem alicujus augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n2360.5" n="C" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">copiousness and dignity of expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his finis est amplitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, which see in full: <cit><quote lang="la">uberi dignitas atque amplitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—Specifically: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudo Platonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">platu/ths th=s e(rmhnei/as</foreign> (Diog. L. 3, 4), which is by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl>, more literally called <hi rend="ital">Platonica latitudo.</hi>—So of metre: <cit><quote lang="la">amplitudo dactyli ac paeonis,</quote> <trans><tr>the fulness</tr>, <tr>richness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:136" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amplius: <entryFree id="n2361" type="main" key="ampli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. amplus.</entryFree>
ampliusculus: <entryFree id="n2362" type="hapax" key="ampli^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amplus</etym>, <sense id="n2362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat larger</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">more magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 322, 19</bibl></cit> Elm.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭuscŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rather more</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
