amplo: <entryFree id="n2363" type="hapax" key="amplo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, old form for amplifico, <sense id="n2363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlarge;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to make glorious</hi>: qui causam humilem dictis amplent, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 120 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
amploctor: <entryFree id="n2364" type="main" key="amploctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amploctor</orth>, v. amplector <sense id="n2364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
amplus: <entryFree id="n2365" type="main" key="amplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>some regard this as a shortened form of <foreign lang="greek">a)na/plews</foreign>, = filled up, full; others, as for ambulus from amb-, rounded out, as superus from super, etc.; v. Doed. Syn. II. p. 113; but perh. it is better to form it from am- and -plus, akin to -pleo, plenus, q. v. Pott</etym>, thus pr., <sense id="n2365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full all round;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large.</hi>—In space, of large extent, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ample</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spacious</hi> (the forms amplus and amplior are very rare in the ante-class. per., and rare in all periods. Amplius is com. in the ante-class., freq. in the class., and very freq. in the post-class. per., the Vulg. rarely using the other forms, but using this 121 times. Amplissimus belongs to prose, and is scarcely used before Cicero, with whom it was a very favorite word. It was also used by Plin. Maj. and Min., but never by Tac., Sall. (in his genuine works), nor the Vulg. Catullus used only the form amplius, and Prop. only amplus, while Tib. and Pers. never used this word in any form. Ampliter is found mostly in Plaut.; and ample and amplissime are used a few times by Cic. and by writers that followed him; syn.: magnus, ingens, latus, late patens, spatiosus, laxus). </sense><sense id="n2365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplus et spectu protervo ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Trag. Rel. p. 94" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 94</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pluto) ter amplum Geryonen compescit undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampla domus dedecori domino fit, si est in eā solitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admodum amplum et excelsum signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis castris parum amplus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticibus in amplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per amplum mittimur Elysium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocemque per ampla volutant Atria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil vulvā pulchrius amplā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplae aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milium amplum grano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum amplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baptisterium amplum atque opacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto est res amplior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amplior Urgo et Capraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis paulo amplior passere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 32, 47, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplior specie mortali,</quote> <bibl pudicitia,</quote> <trans><tr>great enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ampla sunt, valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae satis amplae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur parum amplis adfecerit praemiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampla quidem, sed pro ingentibus meritis praemia acceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplum in modum praemia ostentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 26:6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplis honoribus usi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplis honoribus auctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes in mal. part. or ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">amplam occasionem calumniae nactus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fine opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia ampla refertis Tuque puerque tuus,</quote> <trans><tr>glorious spoils</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 93</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ullum munus aedilitatis amplius aut gratius populo esse possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiis ad perdiscendum amplioribus commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui ampliorem laudem tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquā re esse laudem ampliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis membris plus dedit, id amplius atque augustius ratus (Zeuxis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Augustus vocaretur ampliore cognomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in potestatibus eo modo agitabat, ut ampliore, quam gerebat, dignus haberetur,</quote> <trans><tr>of something greater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules monumentum quam amplissimum faciundum curent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc munus aedilitatis amplissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 1:74" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 1, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui amplissimas potestates dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignibus amplissimis ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona amplissima conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia legatis dedistis amplissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe amplissimorum praemiorum adduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut praemium quoddam amplissimum longi laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera amplissima mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestris beneficiis amplissimis adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudi amplissimae lauream concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus amplissimis adficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimam gloriam consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum amplissimo regis honore et nomine adfeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis aliquem efferre honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis uti honoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos honores adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores adsequi amplissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad honores amplissimos perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus labor fructum est amplissimum consecutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Imp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quir. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei amplissimis verbis gratias egimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia Gallia merito ornatur verbis amplissimis ab senatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis verbis conlaudatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimo populi senatūsque judicio exercitus habuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de meo consulatu amplissima atque ornatissima decreta fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam universi populi, illius gentis, amplissimum testimonium (said of Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.6" n="C" level="2"> In respect of the opinion of others, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est, quamvis amplum sit, id est parum tum cum est aliquid amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hunc hominem magnum aut amplum de re publicā cogitare (putare possumus), qui etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>great or noble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae vobis cara atque ampla sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenerunt corrogati et quidem ampli quidam homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc studium parvi properemus et ampli,</quote> <trans><tr>small and great</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplis doctoribus instructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem sunt amplae et honestae familiae plebeiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est aliquid amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliores ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77</bibl></cit>, where Dinter reads <hi rend="ital">priores</hi>: quo (ingenio) neque melius neque amplius aliud in naturā mortalium est, <pb n="112" /> <cb n="AMPL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius potes (tribuere) amicitiā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius facitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex amplissimo genere nubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimo genere natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genere copiisque amplissimus, id. ib 6, 15: quam (familiam) vidit amplissimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos patruos habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissima civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 5, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud illos Fabiorum nomen est amplissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi hic locus ad agendum amplissimus est visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adgrediar ad illa maxima atque amplissima prius quam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet tribuas ei quantum amplissimum potes, nihil tamen amplius potes amicitiā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimis operibus increscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores in amplissimo consilio collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimi orbis terrae consilii principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: honoris amplissimi puto esse accusare improbos, <hi rend="ital">I esteem it to be the greatest honor</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promotus ad amplissimas procurationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter honores amplissimos cognomenque etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes amplissimae dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.7" n="D" level="2"> Hence, amplissimus (almost always thus in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>) as a title for persons holding great and honored offices, as consul, senator, etc., or as an honorable epithet of the office itself or the body of officers, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most honorable</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">is mihi videtur amplissimus, qui suā virtute in altiorem locum pervenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sex. Rosc. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo et suis et populi Romani ornamentis amplissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Africanus rebus gestis amplissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines amplissimi testimonium de suā re non dicerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Catuli atque ceterorum amplissimorum hominum auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir amplissimus ejus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum Cn. Domitii, amplissimi viri, sustentavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum habeas amplissimi viri religionem (of L. Lucullus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo consilio amplissimi viri judicarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitatus virorum amplissimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros primarios atque amplissimos civitatis in consilium advocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinis amplissimi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 13:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:37:6" default="NO">37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives amplissimos legare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc amplissimum nomen, i. e. senatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimus honos, i. e. consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimo praeditus magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimus ordo, i. e. senatorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimi ordines, i. e. senatus et equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimum collegium decemvirale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an vero vir amplissimus, P. Scipio, pontifex maximus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimum sacerdotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotium amplissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.8" n="E" level="2"> As rhet. epithet: <cit><quote lang="la">amplus orator,</quote> <trans><tr>one that speaks richly and with dignity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herous (pes), qui est idem dactylus Aristoteli amplior, iambus humanior videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>grander</tr>, <tr>more stately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius compositionis genus,</quote> <trans><tr>more copious style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (on the extent of the use of the different forms of the adverb, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">largely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copiously.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2365.9" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n2365.10" n="a" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne ei largi atque ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Rel. p. 173" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 173</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">aptate munde atque ampliter convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Com. Rel. p. 234" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Com. Rel. p. 234</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">extructam ampliter mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:13:7" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 13, 7</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">opsonato ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpositum est ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptus hilare atque ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. prol. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modeste melius facere sumptum quam ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum (digitulos) immersisti ampliter,</quote> <trans><tr>not deep enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.11" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">exornat ample magnificeque triclinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: qui ample valetudinarios nutriunt, <hi rend="ital">in great numbers</hi> (v. the context), Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n2365.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsomely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2365.13" n="a" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampliter dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>fully</tr>, <tr>particularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare ampliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.14" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplē</orth>: duo genera sunt: unum attenuate<cb n="AMPL" />  presseque, alterum sublate ampleque dicentium, <hi rend="ital">with great fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">richly</hi> (v. amplus, II. E.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:201" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 201</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">elate ampleque loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ample sonabant in Pompeiani nominis locum Cato et Scipio,</quote> <trans><tr>full grandly filled the place of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:65" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">further</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi> (syn.: ultra, praeterea); of time, number, and action (while <hi rend="ital">plus</hi> denotes more in quantity, measure, etc.; <hi rend="ital">magis</hi>, more, in the comparison of quality, and sometimes of action; and <hi rend="ital">potius</hi>, rather, the choice between different objects or acts), constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi>, and, in the case of numerals, like minus, plus, propius, q. v., without <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> with the <case>nom.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or rarely with the <hi rend="ital">abl. comp.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, but chiefly in the post-Aug. per.; cf. Zumpt, § 485; Madv. § 305; Roby, § 1273; Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl>; and Draeger, Hist. Synt. I. p. 521 sq. </sense><sense id="n2365.15" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberatum est non tacere [me] amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. Rel. p. 199" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. Rel. p. 199</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ubi erit, de istis rebus tum amplius tecum loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui amplius male faxim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Etiam? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Amplius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 29</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Vale. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Aliquanto amplius valerem, si hic maneres, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam faxo amabit (eam) amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo tanto illum accusabo, quam te accusavi, amplius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo populum servare potissit amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">At ego amplius dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis amplius valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lamentetur miser amplius aequo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:953" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 953</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus vobis opsonatumst an opsono amplius Tibi et parasito et mulieri?</quote> <trans><tr>besides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quam vellem invitatum, ut nobiscum esset amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo exercitu cuncta (probra) fuere et alia amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices ter et amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas aut amplius domos continuare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter nec amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum non solum de his scripserit, sed amplius praecepta (reliquerit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa promi amplius possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si studere amplius possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">auram communem amplius haurire potui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 12: <cit><quote lang="la">sagum, quod amplius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.16" n="b" level="4"> And so very often with the pron. quid, etc.; with the negatives nihil, non, neque, nec, ne; and sometimes with nemo and haud. </sense><sense id="n2365.17" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quid</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid faciam amplius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam amplius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid a me amplius dicendum putatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quaeris amplius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sex. Rosc. 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vultis amplius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius vis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exspectatis amplius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius exspectabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid loquar amplius de hoc homine?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius laboremus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. 31: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet amplius homo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego aliud exoptem amplius, nisi etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid amplius debeam optare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Lo.</hi> Numquid amplius? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Tantum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 25</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> An quid est etiam amplius? <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Vero amplius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod tibi mea ars efficere hoc possit amplius?</quote> <trans><tr>more than this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etenim quid est, Catilina, quod jam amplius exspectes, si etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid amplius scit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ego addidero amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si amplius aliquid gloriatus fuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—And often hoc amplius, where hoc is commonly an <case>abl.</case>, but sometimes may be regarded as a <case>nom.</case> or an <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc amplius si quid poteris,</quote> <trans><tr>any thing beyond this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: et hoc amplius (additur), quod etc., <hi rend="ital">and this further</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 44</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paedagogis hoc amplius, ut aut sint etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mario urbe Italiāque interdicendum, Marciano hoc amplius, Africā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:55" default="NO">1, 5, 55</bibl>; sometimes in <number>plur.</number>, his amplius: <cit><quote lang="la">his amplius apud eundem (est) etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so rarely eo amplius: inferiasque his annuā religione, publice instituit, et eo amplius matri Circenses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeris quid potuerit amplius adsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 60</bibl></cit>: prius quam (hic) turbarum quid faciat amplius, Plaut. <cb n="AMPL" /> Men. 5, 2, 93: <cit><quote lang="la">quare jam te cur amplius excrucies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.18" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nihil</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">habet nihil amplius quam lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:9:46" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habui amplius, quod praeciperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil enim dixit amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil dico amplius: causa dicta est,</quote> <trans><tr>I say no more; I have done with my case</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius dico, nisi me etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius dicam quam victoriam etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, nihil dico or dicam amplius, when one fears to wound by declaring his opinion, etc., <hi rend="ital">I say no more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have nothing further to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus est, Nihili cocio est. Scis cujus? non dico amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, quod equitis Romani filius est, inferior esse debuit: omnes tecum equitum Romanorum filii petiverunt. Nihil dico amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7</bibl></cit> (tacite significat eos dignitate inferiores esse Plancio, Manut. ad h.l.): <cit><quote lang="la">Alterius vero partis nihil amplius dicam quam id, quod etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius nihil respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius addens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil noverunt amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Eccl. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius optet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius quod desideres, nihil erit,</quote> <trans><tr>this will leave nothing to be desired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil amplius oro, nisi ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Augustus nihil amplius quam equestri familiā ortum se scribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non amplius, ad lustrum hoc protolleret unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:1:33" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 1, 33</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">non luctabor tecum, Crasse, amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum non amplius addam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius me objurgabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. Hist. 3:82:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. Hist. 3, 82, 19</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">non habent amplius quid faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: non videbitis amplius faciem meam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:44:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 44, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius illa jam non inveniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium, quo non aliud ad dignitatem amplius excogitari potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra me non est alia amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,044:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Soph. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque hoc amplius quam quod vides nobis quicquamst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque va dari amplius neque etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,001:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Quinct. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam amplius ullae Adparent terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 260</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; 9, 426; 9, 519; 11, 807; 12, 680; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec irascar amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne amplius dona petas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urere ne possit calor amplius aridus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 874</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ne quos amplius Rhenum transire pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne quem amplius posthac discipulum reciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne amplius morando Scaurum incenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. Hist. 1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Hist. 1, 2, 10</bibl> Kritz; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 82, 17: ne amplius divulgetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nequāquam amplius per eamdem viam revertamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Deut. 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite amplius accipere pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4 Reg. 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.19" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">nemo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non restipulatur neminem amplius petiturum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Rosc. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amplius nemo occurreret,</quote> <trans><tr>nobody further</tr>, <tr>no one more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neminem amplius viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo emet amplius,</quote> <trans><tr>no one will buy any longer</tr>, <tr>any more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Apoc. 18, 11</bibl></cit> (for cases of haud with amplius, v. c. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n2365.20" n="c" level="4"> With numerals and numeral forms. </sense><sense id="n2365.21" n="(a)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius horam suffixum in cruce me memini esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam amplius jam in demoliendo signo homines moliebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius annos triginta tribunus fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me non amplius novem annos nato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per annos amplius quadraginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si tandem amplius triennium est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Rosc. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tu faciem illius noctem non amplius unam Falle dolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 683</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveniebat Sabim flumen non amplius milia passuum decem abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum spatium, quod est non amplius pedum sexcentorum, mons continet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 29: amplius sestertium ducentiens acceptum hereditatibus rettuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 68</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic paulo amplius tertiam partem denegem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eum amplius centum cives Romani cognoscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi amplius ducenti ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: non amplius quattuordecim cohortes, Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni multitudine non amplius quadraginta locum cepere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 3</bibl></cit>: torrentes amplius centum, <pb n="113" /> <cb n="AMPL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5, 4, § 10</bibl>.—And very rarely placed after the numeral: <cit><quote lang="la">qui septingentos jam annos amplius numquam mutatis legibus vivunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatum duas amplius horas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 19, 15</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">duo haud amplius milia peditum effugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem amplius versus perdidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trīs pateat caeli spatium non amplius ulnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.22" n="(b)" level="5"> With the <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam amplius horis sex continenter pugnaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatum amplius duabus horis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque triennio amplius supervixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti non amplius quinis aut senis milibus passuum interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 29: non amplius patet milibus quinque et triginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. Hist. 4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. Hist. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit> Kritz: <cit><quote lang="la">est ab capite paulo amplius mille passibus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Capsā non amplius duum milium intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Catilina) cum initio non amplius duobus milibus (militum) habuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 56, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">denas alii, alii plures (uxores) habent, set reges eo amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 80, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">And prob. the following ambiguous cases: cum mille non amplius equitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 105:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 105, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum non amplius mille passuum abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.23" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (postAug. and eccl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius, cum plurimum, quam septem horas dormiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amplius quam septem et viginti dies Brundisii commoratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Toto triennio semel omnino eam nec amplius quam uno die paucissimis vidit horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demoratus dies non amplius quam octo aut decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non amplius apud te quam quarta (pars) remaneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vexillum veteranorum, non amplius quam quingenti numero, copias fuderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud amplius quam ducentos misit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiantur ei ex iis viri amplius quam quadraginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.24" n="d" level="4"> </sense><sense id="n2365.25" n="(a)" level="5"> Amplius, t. t. of judges when they deferred an important case for future examination: <cit><quote lang="la">Amplius adeo prolixum temporis spatium significat, ut judices quotienscunque significarent, adhuc se audire velle, amplius dicebant. Itaque negotium differebant, unde hodieque ampliari judicium differri dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 176</bibl></cit> P.; so Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 39</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also amplio and ampliatio: cum consules re auditā amplius de consilii sententiā pronuntiavissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antea vel judicari primo poterat vel amplius pronuntiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de Philodamo amplius pronuntiaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">And metaph.: ego amplius deliberandum censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.26" n="(b)" level="5"> Amplius non petere, judicial t. phr., <hi rend="ital">to bring no further action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make no further claim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ita satis non dedit, AMPLIVS [A SE] NEMINEM PETITVRVM?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibi ego, Brute, non solvam, nisi prius a te cavero amplius eo nomine neminem, cujus petitio sit, petiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt duo, quae te rogo: primum, ut si quid satis dandum erit, AMPLIVS EO NOMINE NON PETI, cures etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28</bibl></cit> A: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille recusārit satis dare amplius abs te non peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.27" n="(g)" level="5"> Hoc amplius, beside the general use given above (II. <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>), as t. phr. of senators when they approved a measure, but amended it by addition: <cit><quote lang="la">Servilio adsentior et HOC AMPLIVS CENSEO, magnum Pompeium fecisse etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cum essem adsensus, decrevi HOC AMPLIVS, ut etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Seneca: fortasse et post omnes citatus nihil improbabo ex iis, quae priores decreverint, et dicam HOC AMPLIVS CENSEO, Vit. Beat. 3, 2: Quaedam ex istis sunt, quibus adsentire possumus, sed HOC AMPLIVS CENSEO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2365.28" n="(d)" level="5"> To this may be added the elliptical phrases, nihil amplius and si nihil amplius: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil amplius, denoting that there is nothing further than has been declared: sese ipsum abs te repetit. Nihil amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 5, 49, 128</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(res publica) ulta suas injurias est per vos interitu tyranni. Nihil amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; and, si nihil amplius, marking a limit, <hi rend="ital">if nothing more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excedam tectis? An, si nihil amplius, obstem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 148</bibl></cit>.!*? The form <hi rend="ital">amplius</hi> has the ambiguity of the Engl. word <hi rend="ital">more</hi>, which is sometimes an <pos>adj.</pos>, sometimes a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, and sometimes an <pos>adv.</pos>, and some of the above examples would admit of different classifications; as, <cb n="AMTE" /> non amplius dicere, <hi rend="ital">not to speak further</hi> (adv.) or <hi rend="ital">not to say more</hi> (subst.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 51</bibl>; but some of them would admit of only one explanation; <cit><quote lang="la">as, ne quos amplius Rhenum transire pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">amplissimē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n2365.29" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very largely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quibus militibus amplissime (agri) dati adsignati essent,</quote> <trans><tr>in the largest shares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duumviri (deos) tribus quam amplissume tum apparari poterat stratis lectis placavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb.—</sense><sense id="n2365.30" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">most generously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most handsomely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui amplissime de salute meā decreverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissime laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>in the handsomest style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores amplissime gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater cum amplissime ex praeturā triumphāsset,</quote> <trans><tr>with the greatest pomp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placere eum quam amplissime supremo suo die efferri,</quote> <trans><tr>should be carried forth with every possible solemnity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>. V. on this word, Hand, Turs. I. pp. 287-296.</sense></entryFree>
ampsanctus: <entryFree id="n2366" type="main" key="Ampsanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Amp-sanctus</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">Am-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n2366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highly dangerous from its pestiferous exhalations</hi> (hence, in the poets, the entrance to the infernal regions), now <hi rend="ital">Le Mofete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Lago d' Ansante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 565</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampulla: <entryFree id="n2367" type="main" key="ampulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampulla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amb- and olla, as having handles on both (opposite) sides, or an irreg. dim. of amphora</etym>. <sense id="n2367.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel for holding liquids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnished with two handles and swelling in the middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot</hi>, etc. (also made of leather), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n2367.1" n="II" level="1"> Prob. on account of its shape, like <foreign lang="greek">lh/kuqos</foreign>, of inflated discourse, <hi rend="ital">swelling words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bombast</hi>: proicit ampullas et sesquipedalia verba, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 97</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14</bibl>, and ampullor.</sense></entryFree>
ampullaceus: <entryFree id="n2368" type="main" key="ampulla_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampullācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ampulla</etym>, <sense id="n2368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a flask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">big-bellied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a collo ampullacea (pira) appellant,</quote> <trans><tr>a tankardpear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampullarius: <entryFree id="n2369" type="main" key="ampulla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampullārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n2369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flask-maker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 51</bibl>; besides only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampullor: <entryFree id="n2370" type="hapax" key="ampullor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampullor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id. II.</etym>, <sense id="n2370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make use of a bombastic style of discourse</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhkuqi/zw</foreign> (prob. coined by Hor.): <cit><quote lang="la">tragicā ampullatur in arte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
amputatio: <entryFree id="n2371" type="main" key="ampu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ampŭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>amputo</etym>, <sense id="n2371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pruning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lopping off of branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tendrils</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n2371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sarmentorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n2371.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the part that has been cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amputo: <entryFree id="n2372" type="main" key="ampu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">am-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n2372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lop off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune.</hi> </sense><sense id="n2372.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, esp. of plants: amputata id est circum putata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=24" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 24</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumen (ulmi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of other things: praeceidit caulem testīsque una amputat ambo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:7:22" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 7, 22</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pestiferum in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros,</quote> <trans><tr>to mutilate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 761" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ipso vertice capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—In Pliny also of things that are bitten off: <cit><quote lang="la">caudas mugili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n2372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lop off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shorten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amputata inanitas omnis et error,</quote> <trans><tr>removed</tr>, <tr>banished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo esse in adulescente, unde aliquid amputem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet hinc quantum cuique videbitur circumcidat atque amputet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa colloquia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 530" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">amputata loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>in a disconnected manner</tr>, <tr>in abrupt sentences</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amputata oratio et abscisa,</quote> <trans><tr>concise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ampycides: <entryFree id="n2373" type="main" key="Ampy^ci^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ampycĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n2373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patr.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ampuki/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ampycus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the seer Mopsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 316</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampycus: <entryFree id="n2374" type="main" key="Ampy^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ampycus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ampukos</foreign>. <sense id="n2374.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priest of Ceres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:110 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 110 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n2374.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Father of the seer Mopsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:128" default="NO">128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ampyx: <entryFree id="n2375" type="main" key="Ampyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ampyx</orth>, <itype>ycis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ampuc</foreign>. <sense id="n2375.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ; acc.</hi> Ampyca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 450</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n2375.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Phineus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed to stone by Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
amsegetes: <entryFree id="n2376" type="gloss" key="amse^ge^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">am-sĕgĕtes</orth>: quorum ager viam tangit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 21</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
amtermini: <entryFree id="n2377" type="gloss" key="amtermi^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">am-termĭni</orth>: qui circa terminos provinciae manent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 17</bibl> Müll. <cb n="AMYG" /></entryFree>
amtruo: <entryFree id="n2378" type="hapax" key="amtru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">amtrŭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">antrŭo</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">andrŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>v. andruo</etym>, <sense id="n2378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dance around</hi>, in the Salian religious festivals: praesul ut amtruet, inde vulgus redamtruat, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
amuletum: <entryFree id="n2379" type="main" key="a^mu^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămŭlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (Arab. hamalet), <sense id="n2379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sympathetic preservative against sickness</hi>, etc., <foreign lang="greek">fulakth/rion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an amulet</hi> (usu. hung around the neck): <cit><quote lang="la">veneficiorum amuleta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 19, § 66</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:138 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 15, 47, § 138 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
amulius: <entryFree id="n2380" type="main" key="A^mu_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ămūlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)amou/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n2380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Procas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king in Alba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who expelled his brother Numitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ordered his grandsons Romulus and Remus to be thrown into the Tiber;</hi> hence, dirus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 53</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:772 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 772 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
amulum: <entryFree id="n2381" type="main" key="a^mu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămŭlum</orth>, v. amylum.</entryFree>
amurca: <entryFree id="n2382" type="main" key="a^murca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ămurca</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">ămurga</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mo/rgh</foreign> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg.
